conclusion: Analyze the behavior of light rays interacting with the semicircular glass brick.
The semicircular glass brick has a radius R, and light rays strike the flat base at an angle π - γ relative to the horizontal plane.
The critical angle for total internal reflection within the glass is γ.
For light to pass through the semicircular surface without reflection, it must enter at an angle ≤ γ.
The angle of incidence on the curved surface is given by the angle between the incident ray and the normal to the curved surface.
Light rays strike the flat base at an angle π - γ.
The angle of incidence on the curved surface will be π - γ.
The condition for refraction is sin(θ_i) ≤ sin(γ).
Given θ_i = π - γ, we have sin(π - γ) = sin(γ).
The inequality sin(π - γ) ≤ sin(γ) is always true.
The width of the portion of the base through which light passes is determined by the angle subtended by the points where light just passes through.
The angle subtended by these points is 2γ.
The width of the portion of the base through which light passes is 2R sin(γ).
